result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Lazel Wynn Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin Lazel Wynn Sr in court.  Attorney John M Binder in court for Marvin Lazel Wynn Sr.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Motion hearing. Defense request to withdraw motion. Court grants defense's request. Case is adjourned for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin Lazel Wynn in court with attorney John M Binder.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements heard as to defense's filing of a motion to suppress.  State's response to be filed by 9/30/2022.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion to suppress hearing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to Suppress Fruits of Unreasonable Seizure, received and filed

Defendant Marvin Lazel Wynn in court with attorney John M Binder.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin Lazel Wynn in court with Attorney John M Binder; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Hales Corners Officer Boneck. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to the remitter.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Marvin Lazel Wynn in court with attorney John M Binder.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Receipt Number: 22RP013399,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
